definitions.body: Ge 24:49, Ge 31:43, Ex 4:11, Ct So 2:9, Le 13:24, Nu 5:30 + oft. (esp. in laws); sometimes implying a preference, nearly = or rather Ge 24:55 [[יׇמִים אוֹ עָשׂוֹר]] a few days or ten Ju Jdg 18:19, 1Sa 29:3. Prefixed to the first as well as to the second alternative (rare) either (whether) ... or Le 5:1, Le 13:48, Le 13:51; = or, if not Ez Eze 21:15 (si vera l.) Ke Mal 2:17, Job 16:3, Job 22:11.

introducing a sentence, esp. a particular case under a general principle, or = or if Ex 21:31 ´[[אוֹ־בֵן יִגַּח וג]] or if he gore a son, etc. v:Ex 21:36 Le 4:23, Le 4:28 (v. Di) Le 6:2, Le 6:3, Le 25:49 b Nu 5:14, 2Sa 18:13 or if I had dealt falsely against his life, then, etc., Ez Eze 14:17, Eze 14:19 or if I send, etc.
if perchance, 1Sa 20:10 if perchance thy father answer thee with something hard, Le 26:41.

once, with the juss. (as in Ar. with the subjunct. v. Dr:§ 175) = except: Is 27:5 I would burn them together, [[אוֹ יַחֲזֵק בְּמָעֻזִּי]] or else let him take hold (= except he take hold) of my strong-hold, etc.
